subject: Real Estate
title: Climate Change Is Repricing Global Property
description: A quick, practical guide to Climate Change Is Repricing Global Property.

hook.text: Miami Beach property should cost less because of rising seas. Instead, prices keep climbing. Why?

buildup.text: Climate risk is the most underpriced factor in global real estate. Markets are slow to adjust to future threats.

discovery.text: Insurance costs in climate-vulnerable areas are rising 10â€“30% per year, making ownership silently more expensive.

twist.text: Florida passed a law preventing insurers from using sea-level rise models in pricing. The risk is hidden by law.

climax.text: When insurance finally reflects reality, trillions in coastal property worldwide will be repriced overnight.

punchline.text: Climate change will rewrite every property value map on Earth.

quiz.question: Why are climate-vulnerable properties still expensive?
options: Markets are slow to price in future threats
